thread.title: The 31 tallest buildings in the USA
thread.title_full: The 31 tallest buildings in the USA

author: Special for USA TODAY
title: The 31 tallest buildings in the USA

locations.name: getty images new hampshire - city hall plaza
fullscreen new york - one world trade center

organizations.name: university of wyoming residence life & dining services like
getty images/istockphoto georgia - bank of america plaza

text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email The 31 tallest buildings in the USA Almost half of them are all in one city. Any guesses? Post to Facebook The 31 tallest buildings in the USA Almost half of them are all in one city. Any guesses? Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2luHnoa Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs The 31 tallest buildings in the USA Kori Hill, Special for USA TODAY 7:46 a.m. ET Feb. 22, 2017 Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 31. Citigroup Center, New York, N.Y. - Completed in 1977, Citigroup Center at 601 Lexington Ave in New York City, is 915 feet tall. It is known for it‚Äôs slanted roof top, giving it a unique and recognizable place in the city‚Äôs skyline. carlopops, Getty Images/iStockphoto 30. Bank of America Plaza, Dallas, Texas - The tallest skyscraper in Dallas is the Bank of America Plaza at 921 feet and 72 stories tall. It is the third tallest building in the state of Texas. bigdphotographer, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen 29. The Trump Building, New York, N.Y. - 40 Wall Street, or The Trump Building, was built in 1930 and briefly held the title of tallest building in the world at 927 feet until being unseated by the Chrysler building, whose developers adjusted plans to make sure their building would surpass its height. U.S. president Donald Trump bought the tower in 1995. ChrisRuvolo Fullscreen 28. 30 Park Place, New York, N.Y. - 30 Park Place in New York City is also known as the Four Seasons Hotel New York Downtown. It is located in the Tribeca neighborhood of Manhattan, is both a hotel and residential building, and rises 937 feet tall. Spencer Platt, Getty Images Fullscreen 27. One Liberty Place, Philadelphia, Pa. - One Liberty Place is the tallest building in a complex referred to as Liberty Plaza located in Philadelphia. One Liberty is 61 stories and 945 feet tall, while its neighboring skyscraper is just 58 stories. chrisbradshaw, Getty Images/iStockphoto 26. Key Tower, Cleveland, Ohio - Located in downtown Cleveland, Key Tower, a 947 foot skyscraper, is the tallest building in Ohio. Finished in 1991, the building gets its name from its largest tenant, KeyCorp. portgrimes, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen 25. 70 Pine Street, New York, N.Y. - Located in New York City‚Äôs financial district,70 Pine Streetwas built in the early 1930s during what was known as the ‚Äúskyscraper race‚Äù. At the time it was completed, it was the third tallest building in the world after the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building at 952 feet tall. Cl√©ment Bardot Fullscreen 24. 311 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Ill. - 311 South Wacker Drive was completed in 1990 and is the seventh tallest structure in the city at 961 feet. The building is known for its ‚Äúcrown‚Äù, which lights up and makes it the most visible skyscraper at night. HelpingHandPhotos, Getty Images/iStockphoto 23. Columbia Center, Seattle, Wash. - The Columbia Center in Seattle is the tallest building in the state of Washington at 967 feet. The structure was completed in 1985, and has the highest public viewing area on the west coast. Stephen Finn, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen 22. Comcast Center, Philadelphia, Pa. - At 975 feet tall, the Comcast Center tower in Philadelphia, not to be confused with the under construction Comcast Technology Center, was completed in 2008, and named for the largest tenant in the building. The cable company occupies 89 percent of the skyscraper. William Thomas Cain, Getty Images Fullscreen 21. Four World Trade Center, New York, N.Y. - Four World Trade Center is the third building on this list in the World Trade Center complex, located within the financial district of New York City. It opened in 2013 and contains 74 floors at 977 feet tall. Nikolai Fedak, newyorkyimby.com/about-new-york-yimby 20. Wells Fargo Plaza, Houston, Texas - Wells Fargo Plaza was completed in 1983 and was originally referred to as Allied Bank Plaza. It is the tallest all-glass building in the Western Hemisphere at 992 feet. Ali Adair, Flickr 19. Two Prudential Plaza, Chicago, Ill. - At 995 feet, Two Prudential Plaza in Chicago has the distinction of being the tallest building in the world under 1000 feet. It was completed in 1990 and has 64 stories. davidtidwell86, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen 18. JPMorgan Chase Tower, Houston, Texas - The JPMorgan Chase Tower in downtown Houston is the tallest building in Texas at 1,002 feet and 75 stories. The structure was completed in 1981 and at the time was the 8th tallest building in the world. In September of 2008, the building saw significant damage due to Hurricane Ike. Dhanix Fullscreen 17. One57, New York, N.Y. - The One57 building at 157 West 57th Street is the 8th tallest structure in New York at 1,005 feet. Finished in 2014, it is part residential skyscraper, part hotel. There are 92 luxury condominiums, lending the tower the nickname The Billionaire Building. The lower floors are home to 210 hotel rooms at the Park Hyatt. William Edwards, AFP/Getty Images Fullscreen 16. Franklin Center, Chicago, Ill. - The Franklin Center was finished in 1989, though at the time it was known as the AT&T Corporate Center. The building has 60 floors and is the 5th tallest structure in the city at 1,007 feet. Tishman Speyer 15. U.S. Bank Tower, Los Angeles, Calif. - Completed in 1989, the U.S. Bank Tower, also known as Library Tower, was the tallest building in California at 1,018 feet until the Wilshire Center surpassed it in 2017. David McNew, Getty Images Fullscreen 14. Bank of America Plaza, Atlanta, Ga. - Bank of America Plaza in Atlanta is the 13th tallest building in the USA. The 55-floor, 1023-foot tall structure was one of the quickest constructed skyscrapers, taking only 14 months to build. It was completed in 1992. atlexplorer, Flickr Fullscreen 12. (tie) The New York Times Building, New York, N.Y. - Completed in 2007, the New York Times Building rises 1,046 feet and has 52 floors, with a little less than 20 of those belonging to the New York Times media operation. Don Emmert, AFP/Getty Images Fullscreen 12. (tie) Chrysler Building, New York, N.Y. - With its shiny Art Deco-style architecture, the Chrysler Building is one of the most recognizable landmarks in the New York skyline. Completed in 1930, it held the title for tallest building in the world for 11 months at 1,046 feet tall until the Empire State Building was completed. Onnes, Getty Images/iStockphoto 11. Three World Trade Center, New York, N.Y. - Still under construction, Three World Trade Center will be a part of the World Trade Center complex. Scheduled to be completed in 2018, the building is 1,079 ft tall. Drew Angerer, Getty Images 10. Wilshire Grand Center, Los Angeles, Calif. - Set to open in March of 2017, the Wilshire Grand Center will become the tallest building in California at 1,099 feet tall, with 73 floors and 900 proposed hotel rooms. AC Martin 9. Comcast Technology Center, Philadelphia, Pa. - The Comcast Technology Center will be the tallest building in Philadelphia once it opens, estimated to be in 2018, at 60 stories and 1,121 feet tall. Cindy Ord, Getty Images for Comcast 8. John Hancock Center, Chicago, Ill. - The John Hancock Center was built in 1969 and is only 8 feet shorter than the Aon Center (at 1,127 feet). On the 44th floor is America‚Äôs highest indoor swimming pool. mpaskvan, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen 7. Aon Center, Chicago, Ill. - The Aon Center was the tallest building in Chicago and the fourth tallest in the world when completed in 1974, at83 floors and 1,136 feet tall. The Sears Tower was finished only a year later though, quickly claiming the top spot in the city. jlvphoto, Getty Images/iStockphoto 6. Bank of America Tower, New York, N.Y. - Standing at 1,200 feet tall in Midtown Manhattan, the Bank of America tower was completed in 2009 and is known for its green architecture. Robin Marchant, Getty Images for NYCWFF Fullscreen 5. Empire State Building, New York, N. Y. - One of the most famous skyscrapers in the world, the Empire State Building was completed in 1931. It rises 102 floors and stands 1,250 feet tall, which earned it the title of world‚Äôs tallest building for almost 40 years. ventdusud, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen 4. Trump International Hotel and Tower, Chicago, Ill. - The fourth tallest building in America (at 1,389 feet) bears the name of U.S. president Donald Trump. Trump International Hotel and Tower was completed in 2009 and has 98 floors. The building houses a hotel, condos, retail space, and restaurants. Scott Olson, Getty Images Fullscreen 3. 432 Park Avenue, New York, N.Y. - At 85 floors and 1,396 feet, 432 Park Avenue is the tallest residential building in the world and the second tallest building in New York City. It was completed at the end of 2015. Timothy A. Clary, AFP/Getty Images Fullscreen 2. Willis Tower, Chicago, Ill. - Willis Tower, formerly known as the Sears Tower, is the second tallest building in the U.S.A. at 108 stories and 1,451 feet. After its completion in 1973, it remained the tallest building in the world for close to 25 years. Jupiterimages, Getty Images Fullscreen 1. One World Trade Center, New York, N.Y. - The tallest building in America, One World Trade Center was constructed in place of the former Twin Towers after they fell on September 11th, 2001. It opened in 2015 and stands at 1776 feet, an intentional height commemorating the year of the signing of the U.S. Constitution. batuhanozdel, Getty Images/iStockphoto Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide 5. Empire State Building, New York, N. Y. - One of the most famous skyscrapers in the world, the Empire State Building was completed in 1931. It rises 102 floors and stands 1,250 feet tall, which earned it the title of world‚Äôs tallest building for almost 40 years. (Photo: ventdusud, Getty Images/iStockphoto) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The second highest building on our list actually held the title of tallest building in the USA for 25 years, but that title now belongs to another building. The number one spot rises an amazing (and patriotic) 1,776 feet in the air, and shares a city with an astouding 12 other buildings on our list of 31. Any guesses? 
And after you've seen the tallest building overall, explore which building is the tallest in each state in the USA: Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Alabama - RSA Battle House Tower is the tallest building in Alabama, located in Mobile. It was opened in 2007, has 35 floors, and is 745 feet tall. 80monkeys, Getty Images/iStockphoto Alaska - Construction on the Conoco-Phillips Building was finished in 1983 and it remains Alaska‚Äôs tallest building. Located in Anchorage, it is 22 stories and 296 feet tall. ChrisBoswell, Getty Images/iStockphoto Arizona - Chase Tower in Phoenix is Arizona‚Äôs tallest building and has held the title since 1972. It is 40 stories (and 483 feet) tall, but the highest occupiable floor is number 38. Christian J. Stewart, Getty Images/iStockphoto Arkansas - Located in Little Rock is Simmons Tower, Arkansas‚Äô tallest building. It was finished in 1986 and boasts 40 stories at 546 feet tall. James Fisher Fullscreen California - The building now known as U.S. Bank Tower (it‚Äôs had a few titles in its time) is California‚Äôs tallest skyscraper. Located in Los Angeles and standing 73 stories high, it is also the 14th tallest building in the United States. It was completed in 1989. (The Wilshire Grand Center will surpass the U.S. Bank Tower when it opens in March.) David Liu, Getty Images/iStockphoto Colorado - The Republic Plaza building in Denver, Colorado is the tallest building in Denver at 56 stories and 714 feet tall. It was built in 1984 and has over a million square feet of office space. james brown, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen Connecticut - City Place is the tallest building in Connecticut, but only two meters taller than The Travelers Tower, built in 1919. City Place took the superlative in 1980. Both buildings are in Hartford. City Place comes in at 38 stories and 535 feet tall. Natalia Bratslavsky, Getty Images/iStockphoto Delaware - In Wilmington, Delaware, the River Tower at Christina Landing takes the spot for tallest building in Delaware with 27 floors and 340 feet tall. It was built in 2007 and contains residences. M. Williams Florida - The tallest building in Florida is mainly a hotel, but also includes residences and office space. The Four Seasons Hotel & Tower in Miami was finished in 2003 and has 70 floors, standing 789 feet tall. kschulze, Getty Images/iStockphoto Georgia - Bank of America Plaza in Atlanta, Georgia is the tallest building in the state and the 13th tallest in the USA. Built in 1992, it stands 1,023 feet tall and includes 55 floors. klausbalzano, Getty Images Fullscreen Hawaii - The First Hawaiian Center is the tallest building in Hawaii and is also the corporate headquarters of the oldest and largest bank in the state. Standing at 30 floors and 429 feet tall, it is one of the most well known buildings in Honolulu. Fred Hong Idaho - Zion's Bank Building in Boise is the tallest building in Idaho at 18 stories and 323 feet. It is also referred to as Eighth and Main. It is a new building, construction having finished in 2014. James Edmondson Fullscreen Illinois - Formerly known as the Sears Tower, Willis Tower is the tallest building in Chicago and all of Illinois. Build in 1975, for 25 years, it held the title of tallest building in the world. Currently, it now is just the 2nd tallest in the USA at 108 floors and 1,451 feet tall. Jupiterimages, Getty Images Indiana - At 49 stories and 830 feet tall, Chase Tower in Indianapolis is the tallest building in Indiana. It was finished in 1990 and has been known to hang banners cheering on local professional sports teams. csfotoimages, Getty Images Iowa - 801 Grand in Des Moines, Iowa was built in 1991 and remains the tallest building in the state at 45 floors and 630 feet tall. benkrut, Getty Images/iStockphoto Kansas - Epic Center has an apt name, as it's the tallest building Kansas. Completed in 1989, the building is in the city of Wichita, rises 320 feet tall and includes 22 floors. Justin Londagin Fullscreen Kentucky - 400 West Market is located in downtown Louisville, Kentucky and is 35 stories and 549 feet tall. In the days between Thanksgiving and Christmas, the tower displays red and green lights. It‚Äôs been the tallest building in the state since it opened in 1993. benkrut, Getty Images/iStockphoto Louisiana - One Shell Square is 51 stories and 697 feet high, making it the tallest building in the state of Louisiana. It even rises higher than Louisiana‚Äôs tallest peak! matabum, Getty Images/iStockphoto Maine - Portland‚Äôs Franklin Towers is the tallest building in Maine. Built in 1969 and standing at 16 stories and 175 feet tall, it ranks 47th on the list of tallest buildings in each state. SkyF, Getty Images/iStockphoto Maryland - The Transamerica Tower in Baltimore was finished in 1973. It rises 40 stories and 529 feet into the sky, making it the tallest building in Maryland. Raymond Boyd, Getty Images Massachusetts - The 200 Clarendon building in Boston is also known as the John Hancock Tower. At 70 stories and 790 feet tall and built in 1976, it has been the tallest building in Massachusetts for 30 years. Bodhichita, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen Michigan - The Renaissance Center in Detroit, commonly referred to as the RenCen, is a series of skyscrapers located on the city‚Äôs International waterfront. It is owned by General Motors and was built in 1977. The structure is 73 floors and 755 feet tall. Gary Marx II, Getty Images/iStockphoto Minnesota - The IDS Center is the tallest building in Minnesota and has been since 1972. Located in Minneapolis, it is 57 stories and 792 feet tall. Joe Christensen, Getty Images/iStockphoto Mississippi - The tallest building in Mississippi also happens to be a casino. Built in 1999, the Beau Rivage is an MGM Resort located on the water in Biloxi, Mississippi. It has 28 floors and is 347 feet tall. Rian Castillo Fullscreen Missouri - At 42 floors and 634 feet tall, One Kansas City Place is the tallest building in Missouri. It was finished in 1988, and was originally supposed to be a part of a series of buildings, of which it would have been the third tallest. Marek Slusarczyk, Getty Montana - First Interstate Center is the tallest building in Montana. It was built in Billings in 1985 and rises 20 stories and 272 feet high. Chris Van Dyke Nebraska - In Omaha, the First National Bank Tower rises as the tallest building in the state at 634 feet tall. It is a 45 story skyscraper and was completed in 2002. steveodonnell, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen Nevada - Along the Las Vegas strip is The Palazzo hotel and casino. It is not only the tallest building and casino among the other structures in America‚Äôs adult playground, it is also the tallest building in all of Nevada at 642 feet and 50 stories. In terms of square-footage, it is the second largest building in the world. Aneese, Getty Images New Hampshire - City Hall Plaza in Manchester takes the tallest prize in New Hampshire. It was built in 1992 and is 20 stories and 275 feet tall. Getty New Jersey - Jersey City‚Äôs 30 Hudson Street skyscraper is the tallest building in the state of New Jersey. Completed in 2004, it is 42 stories and 781 feet tall, and is visible from New York City. Songquan Deng, Getty Images/iStockphoto New Mexico - Albuquerque Plaza is is the taller of two high rise structures in downtown Albuquerque, New Mexico at 22 stories and 351 feet. The other tower, the Hyatt Regency, is 20 stories. The complex was finished in 1990. David Liu, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen New York - One World Trade Center is famous not just for being the tallest in New York. Also referred to as ‚ÄúFreedom Tower‚Äù, it was built in place of the Twin Towers, which fell during the terror attacks of 9/11. The height of the building is 1776 feet, in honor of the year of American independence. Opening in 2014 and totalling 104 stories (but 94 actual floors), it‚Äôs also the tallest building in the western hemisphere. batuhanozdel, Getty Images/iStockphoto North Carolina - The Bank of America Corporate Center in Charlotte is the tallest building in North Carolina. At 60 floors and 871 feet tall, it holds Bank of America‚Äôs world headquarters. stonena7, Getty Images Fullscreen North Dakota - In North Dakota, the state capitol building takes the crown for the tallest building. Located in Bismarck, the structure is 21 stories and 242 feet tall, and had to be built after a fire ravaged the original capitol building in 1930. The main, tall tower was built between 1931 and 1934, with multiple additions happening over the years. sframephoto, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen Ohio - The Key Tower in Cleveland, Ohio is the tallest building in the state and the 23rd tallest in the US. Built in 1991, it is 57 floors and 947 feet tall and contains 1.5 million square feet in office space. portgrimes, Getty Images/iStockphoto Oklahoma - Built in 2011, Devon Tower in Oklahoma City is 50 floors and 850 feet tall, making it the tallest building in Oklahoma. It surpassed the BOK Tower in Tulsa, which was built in 1975. Buck-Buchanan, Getty Images Fullscreen Oregon - Completed in 1972, Wells Fargo Center is a 40 story, 546 foot tall building in Portland that claims the state‚Äôs tallest building status. The regional headquarters for Wells Fargo, the lobby is home to an authentic 1870 stagecoach that is a part of the bank‚Äôs history. Daniel Deitschel, Getty Images/iStockphoto Pennsylvania - Comcast Center is a 57 story, 973 foot tall skyscraper in Philadelphia. It is the tallest building in Pennsylvania and is the world headquarters of Comcast cable company. They take up 89% of the building. Marek Slusarczyk, Getty Fullscreen Rhode Island - The tallest building in Rhode Island has had a lot of names. It used to be called the Industrial Trust Tower, followed by the Bank of America Building. Now it‚Äôs referred to as its address, 111 Westminster. But the most common (yet unofficial) name is the Superman Building. The tower was built in Providence in 1927 and is 26 floors high and 428 feet tall. coleong, Getty Images/iStockphoto South Carolina - The Capitol Center in Columbia, South Carolina is the state‚Äôs tallest building. Built in 1987, it is 25 stories and 349 feet tall. SeanPavonePhoto, Getty Images/iStockphoto South Dakota - CenturyLink Tower in Sioux Falls is the tallest building in South Dakota at 11 stories and 174 feet. It has dominated the city‚Äôs skyline since it was built in 1986. Lisa Eide Tennessee - The AT&T Building in Nashville, Tennessee is often referred to as the Batman building because of its resemblance to the comic book character. It is 33 stories and 617 feet tall, and was completed in 1994. Sean Pavone, Getty Images Fullscreen Texas - JPMorgan Chase Tower in Houston, Texas is the tallest building in Texas, the 17th tallest building in the US, and also the tallest 5-sided building in the world. It was completed in 1982, includes 75 floors and 52 elevators, and rises 1,002 feet. LUNAMARINA, Getty Images/iStockphoto Utah - The Wells Fargo Center in Salt Lake City is the tallest building in Utah at 24 stories and 422 feet. It opened in 1998. portgrimes, Getty Images/iStockphoto Vermont - Decker Towers in Burlington, Vermont has the distinguishing title of the shortest tallest state building. Built in 1970, it has just 11 floors and rises only 124 feet. ErikaMitchell, Getty Images Fullscreen Virginia - In Virginia Beach, The Westin Virginia Beach Town Center has the title of tallest building in Virginia. Built in 2007, it is a 38-story high rise and unseated a building in Richmond for the top spot at 508 feet tall. William Lee Washington - The Columbia Center in Seattle is the tallest skyscraper in the state and the second tallest on the West Coast. It is 76 stories and 943 feet tall, and covered in Rosa Purino Carnelian granite. Stephen Finn, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen West Virginia - Like North Dakota, West Virginia‚Äôs tallest building is its state capitol. But it‚Äôs a very different building from the modern tower that stands in Bismarck. The West Virginia capitol, located in Charleston, was built in 1925 and is 292 feet tall while only including four floors. ABEMOS, Getty Images/iStockphoto Fullscreen Wisconsin - The U.S. Bank Center in Milwaukee is the tallest building in Wisconsin at 42 stories and 601 feet tall. It opened in 1973 and is famous for nesting Peregrine falcons outside the 41st floor. Since the program launched, 67 falcons have been successfully fledged by the building. EunikaSopotnicka, Getty Images/iStockphoto Wyoming - White Hall is a dormitory building at the University of Wyoming in Laramie. It is also the tallest building in the state at 12 stories and 200 feet tall. University of Wyoming Residence Life & Dining Services Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
